00055   void startThread(void *parameter = NULL) {
00056     ScopedSLock lock(condition_);
00057     if (isRunning()) {
00058       fprintf(stderr, "Trying to start thread when it is already running ! (in Thread::start)");
00059       return;
00060     }
00061 
00062     owner_      = NULL;
00063     static_method_ = Tmethod;
00064     parameter_  = parameter;
00065     should_run_ = true;
00066 
00067 
00068     pthread_create( &thread_id_, NULL, &s_start_static_thread, (void*)this);
00069 
00070     // make sure thread is properly started (signals registered) in case we die right after
00071     // TODO: we could use timedwait if something goes wrong during thread initialization... ?
00072     condition_.wait();
00073   }

00142   void kill() {
00143     should_run_ = false;
00144     if (!thread_id_) return;  // not running
00145 
00146     if (!pthread_equal(thread_id_, pthread_self())) {
00147       // pthread_kill(thread_id_, SIGTERM);
00148       pthread_cancel(thread_id_);
00149       pthread_join(thread_id_, NULL);
00150       thread_id_ = NULL;
00151     }
00152   }
00153 
00156   void sendSignal(int sig) {

00161   void registerSignal(int sig) {

00231   static void * s_start_static_thread(void *thread_ptr) {
00232     Thread * thread = (Thread*)thread_ptr;
00233      // begin of new thread
00234     setThreadThis(thread);
00235 
00236     thread->registerSignal(SIGTERM); // register a SIGTERM handler
00237     thread->registerSignal(SIGINT);
00238     pthread_setcancelstate(PTHREAD_CANCEL_ENABLE, NULL);
00239     // removing comment below = force cancelation to occur NOW, whatever the program is doing.
00240     // pthread_setcanceltype(PTHREAD_CANCEL_ASYNCHRONOUS, NULL);
00241 
00242     thread->should_run_ = true;
00243 
00244     (*thread->static_method_)(thread);
00245 
00246     thread->thread_id_ = NULL; // not running anymore
00247     return NULL;
00248   }
